website_summaries.verdict: The Beoplay's strong design, sound and battery life make it a worthy premium mini Bluetooth speaker contender.
pros: The dome-shaped, aluminum-clad Beoplay A1 speaker looks sleek, delivers relatively high-quality sound for its very compact size, has excellent battery life and works well as a speakerphone
A leather carrying strap allows you to hang the speaker from a hook, loop or branch
cons: It's fairly pricey and heats up a little when played at high volumes for long periods
Also, no protective carrying pouch or case is included

customer_reviews.title: Best sounding BT portable with a good chance of blowing out
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 of these purchased for my family. The sound is amazing, there is no speaker in this category that matches the sound of this. It is great for travel and the battery is really good. THAT BEING SAID... I have two of these with blown out drivers that rattle when reproducing bass frequencies at volume above 40-50%. That makes them useless to me now... This is really ridiculous and not B&O quality standards of their premium equipment. I can't tell you not to buy this, the sound is the best in class, but treat it carefully and hope that if it does go bad, that it is within the warranty period. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: E. Raitses

customer_reviews.title: NOT READY FOR PRIME TIME
customer_reviews.text: As a stand alone unit, this is one of the best bluetooth speakers out there. However, as a stereo pair, the app/pairing process is rarely a success. A frustrating waste of time and a technological embarrassment for B&O. If you want stereo bluetooth, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: O. MITT

customer_reviews.title: Best Sounding Bluetooth Speaker - Abysmal Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: Owned this for just over a year but am just trading in back to Amazon. It is, hands down, the best sounding Bluetooth speaker for its size - each time I use it people are amazed at the quality and the size of it for the sound it produces. Problem is, is you're at 75% or higher volume, it lasts about an hour at most. It's absolutely nowhere near the 24HR promised, I have even tried connecting it to Aux so extend it a bit and it doesn't really help. It also had a habit of overheating and cutting itself down in volume. Such a shame, I will definitely miss the sound quality, but not the battery issues.
customer_reviews.author: JMU KEN

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is the issue
customer_reviews.text: I love the sound from this little speaker. It's small enough to put in your luggage and tote with you, but I warn you, it's heavy for its size. My biggest beef with it is the battery life. Not just that it's short, but that it'll automatically lower the volume drastically when the battery is near dying. Maddening when you are somewhere with background noise, and this basically renders the speaker silent because you can't HEAR it. I'd rather it go 100% full volume until it died.
customer_reviews.author: M. EvansTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Closest Bluetooth Speaker to Perfection that I have used
customer_reviews.text: This has become my go-to portable bluetooth speaker. I have had at least 3 models of the Bose bluetooth speakers, the Marshall Kilburn bluetooth speaker, and several lower-end brand models. Of all of the speakers I have owned, this one has my favorite sound signature. B&O really does a great job with their sound, and the fact that they have put this much sound into something so small wows everyone that has seen it. Excellent volume for the size, and the quality of the sound is just incredible. Couple the sound with what I think is a very elegant design, and this might be the best bluetooth speaker in this size that has ever been made. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Easters

customer_reviews.title: Mass produced in China  and QC shows it
customer_reviews.text: I have owned rhese since they launched in 2016. I have purchased these 4 times, The battery is aweful, The sound is 10/10. BUT the recent 2019 model was leaking air and was defective OUT OF THE BOX. I popped the grill off and looked at the frame and it was cracked FROM THR FACTORY. Seeing this defect makes memthink B&O’s chinese manufacturing is total trash as they just not test these when they are made if they do, this would have stood out as a defect instantly. B&O sold out to china no longer a danish specially. No wonder why they keep loosing profits quarter after quarter.
customer_reviews.author: slendobeja

customer_reviews.title: More like Bangin'! Amirite, Olufsen?
customer_reviews.text: This thing thumps. I had an Oontz 3 Angle, and this blows that out of all bodies of water ever. Easy to set up, has good heft, which means it's built extremely well. I like the option to hang the speaker by the cord, which helps isolate the speaker and avoids potential rattling of things on the same surface. Loud without distortion, clarity without coloring. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Form: Pretty.  Function: GARBAGE.
customer_reviews.text: B&O should be embarrassed by not only their product, but also by their customer support call center rep, who hung up on me. As a first time consumer of B&O, I was willing to pay the extra money to get a beautiful design and a beautiful sound... FIRST TIME CONSUMER. And from the moment I opened the package, to the moment Bluetooth didn't work, to the moment the device wouldn't shut off/Bluetooth pair/hard wire play music at an inaudible level... THIS PRODUCT IS A PIECE OF GARBAGE. AS to the customer service person who hung up on me... you convinced me to NEVER be a consumer of this brand ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I heard these at a store and I couldn't believe the sound coming out of such a small device. The construction, BT ease-of-setup, industrial design, and acoustics all exceeded my expectations. I bought these as a travel companion. I spend a lot of time in hotel rooms and this is perfect for this application. I only gave 4 stars for two reasons... 1) Although stylish, they sacrificed Usability by making the icons so small and difficult to read/detect. I'm over 50 with bi-focals...the icons are a disaster. 2) They should have an app like the UE BT speakers which would allow me to equalize the music. The bass is great, but it can be too much at times.
customer_reviews.author: kimoku

customer_reviews.title: Good Speaker with some flaws!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice sounding speaker that one can tailor its own custom sound with the app. The sound is great and bass but doesn't get crazy loud. Battery life could be better and the buttons on the speaker are squishy. The buttons are awkward to press and on the color I had it was very hard to see what I was touching. This speaker sounds great at around 70-80% volume. Low volumes are really low and can barely hear. Very portable speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Slim Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great while it works
customer_reviews.text: I think its a design flaw, but the speaker keeps busting. I don't play it at super loud volumes; I mostly use it when I travel to clients to have some music in the background while I work. I bought it because of how good the sound quality was supposed to be and how easy it is to travel with, but without fail every few months something internally busts and you start hearing a buzzing sound with the bass, even at lower volumes. B&O has a great warranty program so they'll replace it absolutely free, but having to do that every few months is just frustrating. For the price, definitely expected much better quality.
customer_reviews.author: M R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Sounding, great app!!
customer_reviews.text: This potable Bluetooth speaker has a high quality sound, great battery life at moderate volume and can use the B&O app to change/control the sound quality and other features of the speaker. It is stylish on top of the great sound. It's well worth the price and will outperform most other similarly priced products as long as volume is not your only parameter of quality. Many play louder but few sound better.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Mcginnis

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great, battery life is awful.
customer_reviews.text: It is not louder than my UE Boom, but the sound is really much better - sounds fuller, richer, and definitely a lot better with the lows (bass). I was excited about the battery life - but it is AWFUL. UE Boom, I think, was rated for 12-15 hours, and I usually get 8+. Beoplay A1 is rated for 24 hours, but I'm lucky if I get 4!!! (going to contact B&O support) Also, speaker is...not very rugged. Got a gentle tap from something falling off the shelf above it, and made a noticeable ding in the grill/cover.
customer_reviews.author: Magikarp Salad

customer_reviews.title: Can't see the controls!
customer_reviews.text: Ugh. I would like to throttle whoever the Bang & Olufsen MORON was who thought it was good idea to have the controls so tiny and dark on a BLACK UNIT that you literally CANNOT SEE THEM!!! Let me repeat, you CAN'T SEE THE controls without a magnifying glass! No AC power charger comes with it - unit MUST be charged with a USB cable, which only increased my annoyance. And lastly, the sound quality was "meh" for a $200+ speaker. Poorly designed, average sound quality, and I'm feeling very cheated about this purchase - NOT recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DaveATX

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: The sound is really amazing. I have a Bose soundlink 2 as well and this sounds better. However, Bose has good bluetooth features. This speaker doesn't turn on automatically, you have to switch it on before you can connect. But the most annoying feature is that if the battery is discharged then you can't plug power cable and listen to music. Once the batter is only 20% charged, the volume gets reduced automatically to extend battery life. Bose on the other hand will play music as long as the power cable it connected. But still love the sound....
customer_reviews.author: Kaushik Nagaraj

customer_reviews.title: Positive: Beautiful sound - awesome design. Negative: Difficult to find the buttons on the device
customer_reviews.text: B&O, true to its reputation has created a stunning product when it comes to the overall design and the sound quality. Crisp and clear sound, and it fills the room beautifully! The only reason for me to not give it a 5 star rating is because of the difficulty in finding the buttons on the device. B&O has to work on that, as the product needs to be switched on every time you want to use it, and it takes some effort to locate the buttons - they are so light that they are barely visible.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

Perfect size for travel and it has a clean sound for a small space. I love the color and it matches to all my travel gear.

customer_reviews.title: Could never get it to connect

I do not need to read your poorly written, pathetic instructions, I am not calling support, I will send it back. Its bluetooth, jezzzzz

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMNDED

The strap is ESSENTIAL and makes this so easy to transport around the house. I listen to a wide range of music and broadcasets on this: classic rock, big band/swing, talk radio/podcasts, classic guitar, classical music,....excellent sound quality across the spectrum.

customer_reviews.title: Great little speaker

I ordered a Soundblaster roar 2 thinking it would have better, louder sound but I find myself using this one much more, due that it's much Fuller sounding that the roar 2. Only issue is battery life and that it gets pretty hot. I use a battery bank so it's not an issue for me but I can see it being an inconvenience for some. Overall great speaker for it's size and would recommend it for people that are willing to deal with the battery issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Distorted bass
customer_reviews.text: Mids sound fantastic but bass is distorted. This is the 2nd time in a row I got a defective product from Bang and Olufsen right out of the box. The first one was an A2 which had battery problems. It was promptly replaced but had the same exact problems as soon warranty expired- after 2 years and 2 months. This is A1 supposed to be the replacement to that A2 but I’m very disappointed I have to experience this again. These speakers sound great if they’re not defective but there’s no telling the B&O’s you’re getting from Amazon is the same quality as the one you’ve listened to at your local electronics store.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t last
customer_reviews.text: This worked about 30 times then wouldn’t connect, turn off or reset. Following the reset steps on their website wouldn’t fix it. It got tossed in the garbage since it was out of warranty. Sad because their car systems are the best in the industry.
customer_reviews.author: Guinness

customer_reviews.title: Bang Bang
customer_reviews.text: Very nice high end product. I had just purchased the Doss Soundbox and for the money (20 bucks) was pretty satisfied. Then I walked into the Neiman Marcus store and heard the B&O A1. I knew then what I bought was just a speaker and I needed much, much more. At NM the B&O A1 was $250 at Amazon it was $199. I have it and it handles all sorts of music. Great lows, highs and most impressive mid-range. The A1 looks high end, feels very substantial, and easily outclass the other Bluetooth speakers in its class. "Try it, you'll like it"..... Or get a soundbox; you cant loose for 20 bucks!!!!!

The construction is flawles. The battery life is so far longer than the competition... Worth every penny I have spent Bravo B&O Bravo.....!

customer_reviews.title: I really love this speaker A1
customer_reviews.text: I really love this speaker A1. I love collecting bluetooth speakers. I have had 3 Bose minisound link 2. I like the crispness of the A1 and the base of the mini soundlink 2. I play both together with the my Note 8 (which can connect to 2 bluetooth speakers). This gives me a stereo like sound. I bought the A1 "used" and have had no trouble with it.
customer_reviews.author: Vera City

customer_reviews.title: Great small speaker
customer_reviews.text: Am using this speaker with a cable connection, it provides a wonderful sound, a little light on the highs. The way I am using this swpeaker it was easy to set up. It does time out when played a low volume.
customer_reviews.author: Carlo

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound from a speaker this size
customer_reviews.text: Amazing speaker, but a little bigger than I expected. The sound via USB from my PC is great. When I plugged it in to the USB port, the drivers were installed and it became a USB audio device. It does charge while playing. A speaker this size at this cost should have a PC lock or some way to secure it from being stolen.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Guy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I liked the design and B&O's unique style. However, this speaker is so impractical. It's max volume isn't anything impressive. The bass is barely noticeable. Battery life is so short, a full charge lasts maybe an hour - 2 hours. Overall, would not recommend if you care about practicality
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best speaker in this space!
customer_reviews.text: I have had the A1 for 6 months, and this is the best sounding speaker for its size that I have ever heard...and I have had many different sizes of bluetooth speakers. I'm not an audio-file and don't have statistical analysis; but you know when something just works or sounds amazing...this is it! Well worth the price if you love mobile music. The only negative I can find is that if you're outside in the sun the unit will get hot, which impacts the battery life expected. Small price to pay for greatness.
customer_reviews.author: T. Pitcher

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably good for the size.
customer_reviews.text: I have been a B&O customer for over 20 years, so I bought this little speaker without doubting the sound....even so I was blown away by the loud, clear wide range sound coming out this small thing. I paired it with my Android phone in less than 1 minute and haven't stopped using it ever since. It also has a microphone so you can answer calls...This is the best portable speaker out there.
customer_reviews.author: lifeisgood

customer_reviews.title: I want to love it so bad.
customer_reviews.text: I had to return mine. It's so elegant and the sound is customizable with the app. However, compared to the price there are so many other options out there that are better sounding Bluetooth speakers under $100.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Wow, what rich sound!
customer_reviews.text: The Bang and Olufsen Beoplay works superbly well. Deep rich base sounds, clear and vivid vocals, and in such a small size. It even has a microphone built into the speaker. For the size, this is the best speaker on the market. I only wish different colors were available.
customer_reviews.author: D. Behrendt

customer_reviews.title: Love. Looks like a stylish evening bag
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Love. Looks like a stylish evening bag, if used during a special occation, which I did. Unexpectedly high volume, decent sound quality for such a small speaker. It's not very small thoug, and it's quite heavy. So, only get if sound and design is important to you. There are less expensive, smaller and lighter options in the market, if sound quality and design are not a priority.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Battery Life

It would be nice if there were an indicator to show how much battery life is left. There is some kind of warning when the battery is low, but by that time, it is just about dead.

customer_reviews.title: sound is ok
customer_reviews.text: I connect to my IPHONE was no problem, but the sound was ok but not great, and almost no sound from my kindle fire with the volume turn to max setting, The kindle fire was non blue tooth so I connected a cord to it. I will be returning them.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Addition To The Home Office
customer_reviews.text: It’s beautiful but it doesn’t have the party-starting sound of our JBL Xtreme 2 speaker. That said, it’s a nice addition to the home office.
customer_reviews.author: BiG O

customer_reviews.title: Crystal clear audio
customer_reviews.text: Crystal clear audio. The speaker can get really loud, without distorting the audio. Audio conversations, while using this as a speaker phone, are also clear. Charges quickly with the provided USB-C cable and holds a charge for a full day of use.

customer_reviews.title: Unsatisfactory battery life
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is good but battery life is a big problem. The battery stopped taking charge after 18 months. So you can only use the speaker when plugged to power. That is very sad. Something should be done about the battery

customer_reviews.title: -the buttons were easy to locate without having to pick up the speaker ...
customer_reviews.text: This would be a 5 star product, if: -the buttons were easy to locate without having to pick up the speaker and look for them -the speakerphone capability was better, my coworkers complain I come across crackly and can't hear me sometimes, it does seem to matter which way you rotate the speaker but can't get consistently results.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Sound
customer_reviews.text: Its a perfect sound buster for playing my itunes or answering phone very happy with purchase

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Speaker
customer_reviews.text: We wanted something that could give us some ambient music in our small back yard in Manhattan without being so loud that it bothers the neighbors. This speaker is perfect for that. And it has a surprising amount of bass for a little speaker. Overall the sound seems pretty balanced. I'm tempted to get a second so we can have stereo...

customer_reviews.text: I loved my Beoplay A1 which was purchased in Japan. I ordered the 2nd A1 through Amazon, and I got DOA. Bluetooth connection was OK, but that's all. B&O App could not recognize it. Beoplay update software could not start with this one. I tried with MAC, PC and 2 other USB-C cables. Did not work for the 2nd. I could not do the stereo sound of A1 at all. Today, I returned it. Thanks Amazon for the easy return. I went to Apple Store and ordered the new one as other review did.

customer_reviews.text: It is amazing the sound that comes out of this speaker. I guess I should expect it from Bang & Olufsen. They've been making great speakers and stereos for years. customer_reviews.title: Worth it for design and audio quality.

customer_reviews.author: Y. K

customer_reviews.text: I also have a JBL Charge 3. The A1 is 10x better than the Charge 3. The sound is much more clear and balanced. When you listen to the same song and switch between speakers, the Charge 3 sounds like it is behind a wall in comparison to the A1. This thing rocks!

product_meta.title: Bang & Olufsen Beoplay A1 Portable Bluetooth Speaker with Microphone - Natural
product_meta.description:
With the A1 portable Bluetooth Speaker, music lovers can now hold decades of Bang & Olufsen sound technology and experience in the palm of their hand. This ultra-portable wireless speaker delivers crisp ambient sound in a compact 600 g package. Grab it and go wherever life takes you. It charges in approximately 2.5 hours and provides up to 24 hours of battery life per charge. Created by award-winning designer Cecilie Manz, this mini audio powerhouse looks as good as it sounds: a smooth dust- and splash-resistant aluminium dome, double-moulded polymer base and rugged leather strap balance cool sophistication with warm accents for a unique tactile experience. The convenient Connect button allows you to pick up where you left off, activating your most recently played music at launch. Users can also take advantage of intuitive ToneTouch technology via the Beoplay app to personalize their listening experience, set up wireless stereo pairing and update products with the latest software. Not just a music speaker, the A1 also lets you make calls on the go with a multi-directional microphone that increases voice recognition for everyone on the call. Lightweight but powerful, the sleek A1 delivers signature Bang & Olufsen sound quality when and where you want it.

BOX CONTAINS



Beoplay A1
Quick user guide
USB-C to USB-A cable
feature_bullets: Weighing only 600 g, the ultra-portable Bluetooth speaker lets you enjoy music and make calls on the go.
Bang & Olufsen Signature Sound delivers more sound, more bass and reaches a peak power of 2x140W
Listen longer with up to 24 hours of battery life per charge
A dust and splash-resistant aluminium dome protects the delicate drivers and electronics within when using in your home and outdoors
Connect 2 A1s for a wireless stereo sound experience
